definition: to be stupid/to cheat or deceive/me or I (modest)

sentences.english: Are we so uninformed about issues that we can be bought so easily?
sentences.chinese: 我們真的這麼愚昧無知到不知道自己可以被輕易收買？

sentences.english: He is so simple minded that he does not know the whereabout of Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 他連北京在那裏也不知道，他就是這樣的愚昧無知。

sentences.english: Is this the return thou makest to the Lord, O foolish and senseless people?
sentences.chinese: 愚昧無知的人民，你們就這樣報答上主嗎？

sentences.english: Is the conviction of those to be in goodness, passion or ignorance?
sentences.chinese: 他們是具有善性品德，慾望情感還是愚昧無知呢？

sentences.english: Ignorance is the mother of impudence.
sentences.chinese: 厚顏無恥由於愚昧無知。

sentences.english: For my people is foolish, they have not known me;
sentences.chinese: 他們是愚昧無知的兒女。

sentences.english: Science has no enemy but the ignorant.
sentences.chinese: 科學的敵人是愚昧無知。

sentences.english: I was senseless and ignorant; I was a brute beast before you.
sentences.chinese: 我這樣愚昧無知，在你面前如畜類一般。

sentences.english: So foolish was I, and ignorant: I was as a beast before thee.
sentences.chinese: 我這樣愚昧無知，在你面前如畜類一般。

sentences.english: As a consequence, the country declined into poverty and ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 長期閉關自守，把中國搞得貧窮落後，愚昧無知。

sentences.english: We'll be talking about Milton's blindness.
sentences.chinese: 我們下次會說到彌爾頓的愚昧無知。

sentences.english: He drummed two injunctions into the mind of the ignorant.
sentences.chinese: 他向愚昧無知的人羣諄諄教誨兩條誡命。

definition: lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
to murder without blinking an eye (idiom)/ruthless/cold-blooded
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3
